title: Presidium
content:
Presidium is a documentation framework that enforces industry best practices for documenting software systems. 
Presidium provides software teams with the tools to acquire, revise, categorize, utilize and evaluate small 
document fragments that get aggregated into a well structured static website. Presidium is based on familar tools already in use by many software development teams.

Presidium was created by SPAN Digital and is licensed under Apache 2.0

title: Required Software
content:
The following tools are required to build and run your site locally:

npm v3.10+

ruby v2.1+

bundler v1.14.3+

Presidium uses:

npm to build, run and publish your site

ruby to run Jekyll 

bunder to manage Jekyll dependencies

All required dependencies are managed via npm scripts and are local to each site you create, so there is 
no need to install and configure Jekyll.

title: OSX
content:
NPM

Install using the node package or nvm

node v6.10 (LTS)

npm v3.10

Ruby

Requires ruby >= 2.1 available using homebrew:



Bundler

title: Debian
content: The following script may be used to provision a Debian based environment:

title: Create a Site
content:
Download and extract the sample template

Run the following from your project directory to install required dependencies:



If you get an error, check that you have the following prerequisites installed on your environment:

npm v3.10+

ruby v2.1+

bundler v1.14.3+

title: Run Presidium
content:
To start your site, run the following from your project folder:



This will build your site to dist/site and serve it locally on: http://localhost:4000/

title: Edit your Site
content:
Once your basic site is up and running, you can start making changes to the following files and folders:

\_config.yml To configure your site metadata, sections and properties

content/ Content folder for all your articles

media/ Media folder for static assets such as images, attachments or css

Updates to content, media or css can be made without having to restart the local server. Structural or changes to configuration currently require a server restart.

title: Publishing your Site
content:
Github Pages

To publish using Github Pages, commit and push your site to a Github repository and run the following:



This will push your generated site to a gh-pages branch in your repository. You will need to 
enable gh-pages 
in your repository settings to make your site public.

Static Site

The generated static site can be found in dist/site if you choose to host your site elsewhere.

title: Article Structure
content:
Articles follow the natural alphabetic ordering of files and folders. 
Articles in sub directories use the folder name to group articles in the main menu.
The name of a category may be overridden using an index.md file 
The following example demonstrates how to order and organise articles and subsections:

title: Article 2.1
Article 2.2
Article 2.3
With an Index
content: If an index.md is provided with a title, the tile is used:

title: Without Index
content: If no index.md is provided in a directory, the directory name is used.

title: Themes
content:
Presidium uses http://bootswatch.com/ for managing its themes.  If you wish to change the 
current theme of your documentation, site, simply navigate to /media/css/\_sass and edit the \_variables.scss file:



Presidium gives you the supported themes listed.  Uncomment the theme that you want (And comment the existing one), 
Presidium if started with npm start will pick up the change, and the hotloader will update the change allowing you 
to refresh the browser window and view the new theme.

Logo

The default logo image is placed and loaded from /media/images/logo.png.  If you wish to update it, simply override 
the existing file in the folder.  Its size ratio should be:

260px × 124px

title: Using Roles
content:
Various roles can be added to a site to allow readers to 
filter by a target audience. This is an optional feature that can be 
enabled by setting roles in your site config:



Articles and menu items are shown depending on the selected role. 
If no role is provided, an article will default to all.

title: Business Analyst
content: Sub category article for Business Analyst role.

title: Developer
content: Sub category article for Developer role.

title: For All Roles
content:
Articles and menu items are shown depending on the selected role.
Articles default to All Roles and are shown by default if no role is specified.

title: For Business Analyst Only
content: Article for Business Analyst using single role:

title: For Developers and Testers
content: Article for Developer and Tester roles (using a collection):

title: For Developers Only
content: Article for Developer using an optional collection:

title: Article Statuses
content:
Each article may be assigned a status to track its lifecycle:

draft

review

published

retired

Statuses can be set in the site's front matter:



To enable or disable statuses from showing on your generated site, 
simply enable or disable the following setting in the site config:

title: Draft
content: A draft article:

title: Review
content: An article ready for review:

title: Published
content: A published article:

title: Retired
content: A retired article:

title: With an Author
content:
Each article may have an author in the front matter:



Links to authors are optional. To enable, set a base url in your site config:



To hide or show authors on your generated site, 
simply enable or disable the component in your site config:

title: Without an Author
content: Authors are optional and may be ommitted.

title: Nested Articles
content:
By default, articles in sub sections are nested on a page. 
This allows users to read articles on a single page or to only view articles at a certain level.
As a reader navigates down the menu tree, only articles within a nested section are shown. 

This can be enabled or disabled using the following site config:

title: Issues
content: If you experience any issues with Presidium, please log an issue so that we can continue to improve the product.

title: License
content: Presidium was created by SPAN Digital
